name: LED Bulb Replacement
notes: Flourescent lamps are replaced with LED bulbs, saves 4% of building electricity consumption per year

name: LED fixture Replacement
notes: 64kW flourescent lights are replaced with 25W LED lighting fixtures. Saves 7% of building electricity consumption per year

name: Lighting Controls
notes: Includes vacancy sensors, daylight dimming sensors and timeclocks. Saves 2% of building electricity consumption per year

name: Pump Upgrades
notes: Upgrade all pumps (all heating systems and hot water circulation) which makes them more efficient. Saves 5% of building electricity usage per year

name: IT Server Upgrades
notes: Upgrades existing IT server equipment with newer high efficiency equipment. Saves around 6% of electricity consumption per building

name: Boiler Upgrades
notes: End-of-life boilers are replaced with higher efficiency models, which saves 5% of building gas usage per year

name: Insulation Upgrades (walls)
notes: Adds extra insulation to the walls of the building. Saves 6% of building gas usage per year

name: Insulation Upgrades (roof)
notes: Adds extra insulation to the roof of a building. Saves 8% of the buildings gas usage per year

name: Insulation Upgrades (pipework and ductwork)
notes: Adds insulation to all heated pipes and ducts. Saves 1% of buildng gas usage per year

name: Air Source Heat Pump Retrofit
notes: For Dorset House only: Retrofitting an ASHP will eliminate gas usage completely in Dorset House, but increase the electricity consumption by 15%. If any other gas-saving projects are applied to Dorset House, apply the savings as electricity savings instead. If you retrofit an air source heat pump, the boilers will be removed, so you cannot also do boiler upgrades.

name: Heating, ventilation and cooling Controls Upgrades
notes: Enables energy-using equipment to be smarter, eg. heating and ventilation only comes on when someone walks into a room, saves 5% gas, 2% electricity per year

name: Glazing upgrades (windows and doors)
notes: Upgrades all windows and doors to triple glazing. Saves 7% of the building's total gas usage per year
